title.narrative: Civic Engagement Alliance in Central America

description.narrative: Convening and Convincing in Central America

ICCO has the lead role in organizing the Civic Engagement Alliance program in Central America with converging actions with CNV International and Kerk in Actie. The program works with two of the most marginalized groups in the region: youth and Indigenous and Forest Dependent people.

activity-description.narrative: Regional Lobby and Advocacy actions on Forests, Climate and Communities

Number of cases where local and national authorities actively consult the poor and marginalized and CSOs

advocacy initiatives carried out by youth organizations in cooperation with youth

title.narrative: # advocacy initiatives (e.g media articles, position papers) carried out by CSOs with their membership and constituency

# organizations with representation and participation of empowered youth that claim rights towards the private sector
# joint ownership by government of indigenous people's agenda (including rules and regulations)
# demonstrable shifts in communications by lobby targets (national or international government) based on lobby activities of IPOs and CBOs
# times that CSOs succeed in creating space for CSOs demands and positions though agenda setting, ionfluencing debate and/or creating space to engage
# IPOs and CBOS involved in policy processes and networks in an inclusive way and representing their members' interest
# joint decision making processes in a community together with indigenous leaders, women and youth

# youth (M) participating in dialogue spaces with CSOs and authorities
# indigenous leaders (Y) that have a voice and are aware of their rights

# demonstrated cases of public support for youth claims (and voices)
# cases where youth claims (and voices) are mentioned in the media

# demonstrated cases of support / congruent responses by lobby targets in reaction to advocacy initiatives (e.g speeches, statements, media outlets, papers)
# CSOs within the CEA program that get financing

comment.narrative: This is the 2019 total score. In 2019 2 organizations were financed, the aggregate figure stays 4
